meta_summary: These groups coordinate the logistics of the Solid Practitioners meetings, including scheduling, time confirmations, and sharing meeting agendas, notes, and recordings. Discussions also focus on improving meeting organization, note-taking equity, and resolving scheduling conflicts to ensure smooth and accessible meetings for participants.
sample_group_titles: Routine Meeting Coordination and Logistics
Practitioner Working Group Meeting Logistics and Scheduling
Coordination and Scheduling for Solid Practitioners Meetings
Solid Practitioners Meeting: Jan 22 Logistics, Minutes, and Initial Feedback
Implementing and Configuring the Solid Practitioners Reminder Bot
Scheduling and Coordination for Catalog Viewer Presentation
Solid Practitioners Feb 5 Meeting Logistics and Schedule Conflict Resolution
Practitioners Meeting Logistics and Future Agenda
Solid Practitioners Meeting Schedule Confirmation
Discussion of Practitioners Group Meeting Time and Cadence

meta_summary: These discussions center on standardizing metadata for Solid-OIDC providers to improve the user experience during login and registration. The conversations explore the need for programmatically accessible definitions, labels, and icons from Pod providers' WebID documents to ensure consistency and ease of use across different Solid applications.
sample_group_titles: Proposal for Standardizing Solid-OIDC Provider Metadata
Standardizing Pod Provider WebID Document Information

meta_summary: These groups discuss user experience and access control considerations for Solid applications, particularly within the context of Solid Application Interoperability (SAI).  The conversations explore clear communication of data access levels (public, private, shared) to users, with a focus on effectively handling PII and leveraging naming conventions.
sample_group_titles: User Profile, PII Handling, and Access Control UX for Solid Applications
Clarification and Resource Sharing for Solid Application Interoperability (SAI)

meta_summary: The groups focus on community pod setup, access control, and architectural designs for federated geosearch. Discussions involve creating and debugging group pods on TrinPod, exploring access management using private triples, and recommending community pods for efficient data aggregation and governance in geospatial applications.
sample_group_titles: Setting up the Practitioners Group Pod on TrinPod
Architectural Design for Federated Geosearch using Community Pods
TrinPod Group Pod Discovery Mechanism and Privacy

meta_summary: The conversations revolve around Solid data indexing and search capabilities, aiming to improve search functionality in Solid applications. Discussions cover various indexing strategies, the need for a standardized search API, the sharing of existing implementations, and announcements for upcoming workshops and sessions related to decentralized search across Solid Pods.
sample_group_titles: Solid Data Indexing Strategies and Standardization
Management and Follow-up for the February 19th Search Meeting
Indexing and Searching Use Case Homework
SoSy 2025 Sessions: Solid Together and ESPRESSO Decentralized Search
Search Capabilities in Solid Applications
Call for Papers for DESERE 2025 Workshop

meta_summary: These discussions center on developing web components for Solid, focusing on tools, libraries, and integration strategies. Developers coordinate meetups to tackle technical challenges like reactive rendering and interoperability, ultimately creating a GitHub wiki for ongoing collaboration.
sample_group_titles: Planning and Technical Discussion for Solid Web Components Group
Coordination for Solid Web Components Meetup
Tools and Libraries Practitioner Meeting (May 13)

meta_summary: The Sleepy Bike project's progress and challenges are discussed, including its geographic scope, relationship with WarmShowers, and technical implementation. Updates reveal internal struggles, resulting in a project 'schism', alongside requests for advice about bike rentals.
sample_group_titles: Sleepy.bike Project Experiences Internal Schism
Request for Paris Bike Hiring Advice
Welcome to Mariha and Sleepy Bike Introduction
Inquiry into Sleepy Bike Geographic Scope and WarmShowers Relationship

meta_summary: Conversations revolve around Solid governance, including the Practitioners Group's role, elections for co-chairs, and representation on the ODI Advisory Committee. Issues of censorship, privacy, conflict resolution (like the SolidCouch issue), and collaboration with other communities like Valueflows are also addressed.
sample_group_titles: SolidCouch Conflict and Code of Conduct Committee Status
Practitioners Group Role in ODI Governance, Charter, and Elections
Solid Practitioners Group Co-Chair Elections
Introduction of Valueflows Community Members and Project Scope
Solid Governance and ODI Meeting Promotion
Revised Solid Practitioners Group Scope and Governance
Confirmation of W3C Solid Mailing List
Discussion of CG Proposal on Censorship and Privacy
Background on Hospitality Exchange Communities
Announcement of ODI Solid Advisory Committee Meeting

meta_summary: The implementation of Solid notifications is discussed, covering topics such as different approaches to webhooks and support across different Pod providers. A dedicated Matrix chat channel for Real Time Solid (RTS) efforts was created to facilitate better coordination, while scheduled meetings faced rescheduling and a hiatus due to low attendance.
sample_group_titles: Solid Practitioners Biweekly Meeting Schedule and Hiatus
Establishing a Chat Channel for Real Time Solid (RTS)
Discussion on Solid Notifications Implementation and Pod Support

meta_summary: RDF and Linked Data Shapes are explored, including collaboration on SHACL shapes and ontologies, and developing a Linked Data Shape Manager. Discussions cover binary RDF formats like HDT and CBOR-LD, with one member releasing a tool to convert DICOM metadata to RDF.
sample_group_titles: Collaboration on Linked Data Shapes
Discussion on Binary RDF Formats (HDT, CBOR-LD) and Performance
Collaboration on SHACL, Ontologies, and RDF Ecosystem Description
DICOM Metadata to RDF Converter Tool

meta_summary: The group debated a proposal regarding "Value Generation and Monetization Strategies" for Solid Practitioners, balancing the need for economic sustainability (to drive adoption) with core community values opposing data privatization and exploitation, referencing the WarmShowers failure.
sample_group_titles: Debate on Solid Practitioners Strategy and Monetization Ethics

meta_summary: These groups are exploring ways to educate newcomers about Solid, including experimenting with a personalized GPT agent trained on Solid information. Discussions also focus on creating explainer content highlighting Solid's practical applications and coordinating efforts with the W3C Community Group 'Solid Explainer' initiative to improve onboarding.
sample_group_titles: Solid Explainer Content and Onboarding Strategy
Experimenting with Solid GPT Agent

meta_summary: A member declined an invitation to join the W3C Solid Community Group due to time constraints, leading to a clarification that the Practitioners group prioritizes active project work over general Solid happenings.
sample_group_titles: Scope of External Solid Involvement

meta_summary: These groups focus on promoting and sharing information about Solid Data Modules and Data Wallets. The conversations involve sharing content on platforms like wedistribute.org and disseminating blog posts to clarify concepts related to data management with Solid.
sample_group_titles: Sharing Solid Data Modules on wedistribute.org
Data Wallets Blog Post Sharing

meta_summary: A newcomer sought advice for building a Proof of Concept (PoC) for career data management, leading to community recommendations favoring the Community Solid Server (CSS), Javascript/Typescript, and guidance on ontology and interoperability conventions.
sample_group_titles: Guidance for Building a Solid Career Data Management PoC

meta_summary: An announcement was made regarding Solvent, a project enabling Solid applications to run natively over a user's file system using Manas and Tauri.
sample_group_titles: Announcement of Solvent: Native Solid Apps over Filesystem

meta_summary: The Solid Localization Strategy groups are discussing the best tools and workflows for translating Solid projects into multiple languages. Conversations cover platforms like Weblate, frameworks like Fluent and Vue i18n, and integrating RDF data from sources like Wikidata for internationalization.
sample_group_titles: Localization Strategy and Tooling (Fluent/Weblate)
Localization Meeting Tools and RDF Data Discussion

meta_summary: These groups explore the readiness of Solid for production use, covering topics like server implementations, security considerations (including HIPAA compliance), and infrastructure migrations.  Members are also sharing resources, such as a PeerTube channel for Solid practitioners and documentation for DIY Solid setups, along with announcements like the Solid World call for speakers.
sample_group_titles: Solid Practitioners PeerTube Channel and Platform Sustainability
Enterprise Solid Security, Interoperability, and HIPAA Compliance
Status of Solid for Production Use
Solid Infrastructure Migration and Solid World Call for Speakers
Ewingson's Solid Setup Documentation and Hydrogen Bug

meta_summary: These groups revolve around job opportunities within the Solid ecosystem. Participants are sharing job search resources and announcements, including ODI's recruitment for multiple Solid roles, with a focus on candidates able to work in London.
sample_group_titles: ODI Hiring for Solid Roles
Job Search and Resource Sharing

meta_summary: Jeff Zucker shared a link to a Spanish-language discussion on the Solid forum (Podspace), leading to positive engagement and cross-invitation from Spanish-speaking members.
sample_group_titles: Solid Forum Thread on Podspace and Spanish Speakers

meta_summary: Mariha requested high-level vision and narrow technical resources to encourage a return to software development, receiving several links tailored to her background in distributed systems.
sample_group_titles: Seeking Inspiring Solid Development Resources

meta_summary: These conversations centered on integrating Solid with the Fediverse, including discussions on specific tools like Mastopod and Peertube, the ActivityPods approach, and the launch of a new federated forum on We Distribute. Users shared experiences, troubleshooting tips, and announcements related to connecting Solid with decentralized social networks.
sample_group_titles: Fediverse Tools and Deployment
Solid/ActivityPub Integration Meeting Recap and Client Limitations
Launch of Federated Forum on We Distribute

meta_summary: The group clarified that formal organizational affiliation is not required for membership in certain Solid groups, leading to a brief mention of Inrupt hiring status.
sample_group_titles: Organizational Affiliation and Solid Group Membership

meta_summary: Participants discussed the current lack of standardized server-side pagination methods in Solid for handling large datasets like chat logs, noting existing workarounds and limitations regarding document vs. triple level operations.
sample_group_titles: Challenges of Server-Side Pagination in Solid

meta_summary: Following a discussion on cryptographic keys, an accepted standard (RFC 9421) for message signing was introduced, prompting planning for a future dedicated meeting in March to discuss its application within Solid.
sample_group_titles: Follow-up on Private Keys and Message Signing Standard

meta_summary: A proposal was made and supported to establish a subgroup dedicated to Server Practitioners to enhance alignment and functionality deployment, alongside feedback requesting corrections to the recent search API meeting notes.
sample_group_titles: Proposal for Server Practitioners Subgroup and Feedback on Meeting Notes

meta_summary: The discussions revolved around planning non-competitive Solid hackathons focused on specific projects like PASS, outlining goals, structure, and reflecting on the nature of such events. A Gitter chat room link was shared, likely intended to facilitate real-time collaboration during the hackathon.
sample_group_titles: Solid Hackathon Planning and Format
Isolated Chat Room Link

meta_summary: The discussions explore Solid interoperability challenges, sharing resources and exploring different architectural approaches. The focus is on contrasting 'everything apps' like Anytype with specialized apps relying on strong interoperability, highlighting the potential role of PodOS in bridging this gap.
sample_group_titles: Anytype, Local-First, and Generic vs. Specialized App Strategy
Solid Interoperability and Practices

meta_summary: A non-technical startup from Australia introduced themselves, expressing interest in integrating Solid Pods and seeking connections with local experts or Inrupt for collaboration.
sample_group_titles: Australian Startup Introduction and Collaboration Inquiry

meta_summary: An announcement was made regarding the launch of the Oracle Aconex Accelerator, integrating Solid technology into Construction technology.
sample_group_titles: Announcement of Oracle Aconex Accelerator Launch

meta_summary: Mohammad Bahrani from the University of Southampton introduced his research project focused on efficient, secure, and sovereign search over Solid pods using LLMs and Federated Learning.
sample_group_titles: Introduction of Researcher on Solid Search and LLMs

meta_summary: The team decided to separate the Solid Catalog data from specific applications by moving it to its own repository to improve data independence and requested community feedback on the structure.
sample_group_titles: Restructuring the Solid Catalog Repository

meta_summary: These conversations centered on the technical aspects of ActivityPods, including ActivityPub implementation over Solid, ODRL, and RDF document structure requirements. Developers shared compatibility reports detailing issues encountered while adapting applications to ActivityPods.
sample_group_titles: ActivityPods Presentation and Technical Discussion
ActivityPods Compatibility Report Sharing

meta_summary: Links were shared referencing a W3C public-solid email announcing the scheduling of a meeting focused on Conflict-free Replicated Data Types (CRTDs) in Solid.
sample_group_titles: CRTDs Meeting Scheduling

meta_summary: Jeff Zucker facilitated an introduction between two members interested in discussing the application and policies of Solid technology within the context of the Mexican government.
sample_group_titles: Connecting Developers for Solid in Mexico

meta_summary: The discussion involved announcing a forum post on integrating ActivityPub into Solid specs, related concepts like inbox validation, and mention of lost notes regarding an AP layer experiment and a new abstraction use case.
sample_group_titles: ActivityPub Integration, Inbox Validation, and Abstraction Use Cases

meta_summary: A request was made to community members to contribute their Solid projects and use cases to a list on the Solid forum to demonstrate Solid in action.
sample_group_titles: Call for Real-World Solid Use Cases

meta_summary: A developer struggled with deploying NSS using Nginx and SSL until they identified and resolved a configuration mismatch in their firewall rules, confirming the use of Solid for multi-tenancy in a production app.
sample_group_titles: Node Solid Server (NSS) Deployment Troubleshooting

meta_summary: The discussions involved planning an international panel for the upcoming Solid Symposium, inviting participation in a Solid panel discussion at the State of Open Con conference, and sharing a survey regarding SHACL shapes. There was also a discussion troubleshooting issues with link previews on Solid event calendar links.
sample_group_titles: Troubleshooting Solid Event Calendar Link Previews
Proposal for Solid Symposium International Panel
Upcoming Events and Surveys

meta_summary: These discussions center on privacy and data integrity challenges within LLMs used with Solid.  Key concerns include data forgetting, user consent, transparency in LLM training data, and the exploration of tools like RDF and Model Context Protocol (MCP) to address these issues within the Solid ecosystem.
sample_group_titles: Solid Integration with Model Context Protocol (MCP) and LLM Privacy
Introduction to Solid Ecosystem RDF Description Project
LLM Data Transparency, Consent, and Linked Data

meta_summary: A new working group was announced to define a common shape for Products and Services, leading to a debate on whether to use 'Project' or 'ProductOrService' as the superclass and how to model organizational relationships.
sample_group_titles: Defining Shapes and Schema for Products and Services

meta_summary: The focus here is on the availability and planning for JavaScript-based tools for working with RDF data. This includes discussion of RDF library support in other languages like Python and Perl, as well as scheduling an overview presentation of existing JavaScript RDF tooling.
sample_group_titles: Scheduling RDF JavaScript Tooling Overview
Notes on RDF Libraries in Python and Perl

meta_summary: These conversations revolve around the development, maintenance, and governance of the Solid Catalog, a repository for Solid applications and resources. Topics include frontend development, search implementation, data correction, metadata definition, bug fixes, repository governance, and inclusion of research papers.

meta_summary: These discussions address the architecture and implementation of Solid, including debates on security versus interoperability in Datasolids, the architecture of projects like MANDAT, and sharing architecture-as-code tools for visualizing Solid setups.
sample_group_titles: Datasolids Architecture, Security, and Solid Protocol Adherence
MANDAT Project Requirements, Delegation, and Architecture

meta_summary: The conversations in this cluster focus on various aspects of authentication and authorization within Solid. Topics covered include finding UMA flow implementations, harmonizing authentication specifications, authenticating non-web applications, and implementing SSO bridges for Solid applications.

Authentication for Non-Web Applications

meta_summary: The group was reminded to provide feedback on the proposed ODI governance structure and was provided instructions and encouragement to self-nominate for the Solid Operations Advisory Committee (OAC) before the March 30 deadline.
sample_group_titles: Feedback and Nominations for ODI Governance Committees

meta_summary: Discussions focused on application development within the Solid ecosystem. This includes sharing and requesting information about projects like 'Solid Compound' for improved UX/DX, as well as the announcement and discussion of new tools like a CSS component scaffolder designed to simplify development. Participants also followed up on presentations with technical questions about PodQuest, WebID scoped indexes, and open-sourcing the application.
sample_group_titles: Post-Presentation Follow-up and Technical Queries
Request for Information and Link to Solid Compound Project

meta_summary: Members discussed news regarding a non-Solid initiative led by RFK Jr. to aggregate health data for research, raising concerns about consent and centralized data control.
sample_group_titles: Discussion on External Health Data Aggregation Plans

meta_summary: Users reported difficulties accessing resources due to broken links resulting from the Inrupt migration, including a Solid Symposium page and the Real Time Solid website, with the page owner acknowledging the issue.
sample_group_titles: Broken Inrupt Migration Links

meta_summary: Conversations revolved around Web Access Control (WAC) mechanisms within Solid. The group debated the historical use of `acl:trustedApp` and considered alternatives like SAI for authorization. They also explored the use of Group WebIDs versus URIs for access control, particularly for private group memberships, and inquired about dedicated channels for WAC discussions.
sample_group_titles: Group WebIDs, ACLs, and Private Group Membership
Discussion on Trusted Apps and Authorization Alternatives
Location for WAC Discussions

meta_summary: A link to Synovient was shared, prompting a user to inquire about its technical differences from the open-source Solid Protocol, which could not be answered due to Synovient's lack of technical visibility.
sample_group_titles: Comparison of Synovient and Solid Pods

meta_summary: A user shared links to the GitHub repository and a Peertube video for MyceliumWebServer.
sample_group_titles: Sharing Mycelium Web Server Links

meta_summary: The Contacts client-client spec group sought feedback from practitioners regarding the feasibility of migrating from `vcard:AddressBook` to `foaf:AddressBook`, acknowledging the need for backward compatibility support over several years.
sample_group_titles: Solid Contacts Spec Migration Discussion

meta_summary: Members shared mixed feedback on the utility and security of GenAI code editors/copilots, discussing both positive formatting capabilities and negative experiences involving bugs and potential security vulnerabilities.
sample_group_titles: Discussion on AI Code Generation Effectiveness

meta_summary: Josh Cornejo raises detailed questions regarding network security (DDoS) and loop prevention in decentralized social queries, which Niko addresses by detailing unique query IDs and asynchronous forwarding logic.
sample_group_titles: Addressing Security and Loop Prevention in Social Queries

meta_summary: Jeff followed up on scheduling a podcast interview with Damon, who apologized for the delay due to a family emergency and confirmed he would reach out via email.

meta_summary: Lukedary shared positive progress from a development day but criticized the poor quality and outdated state of official Solid documentation, especially from Inrupt, while praising community resources.

meta_summary: A user inquired about a rumored name change for Solid, leading to a discussion distinguishing 'Linked Web Storage' as the technical specification from 'Solid' as the preferred solution brand.
